block.p: Sarah Ann Greene, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Richard C. Greene of Green Bay, Wis., was married yesterday to Paul Henry Lehman, the son of Beatrice Lehman of New York and Theodore H. Lehman of Honolulu. The Rev. Gery G. Meehan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Old St. Joseph's Church in DePere, Wis., with Rabbi Michael V. Tillman taking part.
The bride, who graduated cum laude from Boston University, and the bridegroom, a graduate of Vassar College, received M.B.A. degrees from Harvard University, where they met.

Sarah Ann Greene, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Richard C. Greene of Green Bay, Wis., was married yesterday to Paul Henry Lehman, the son of Beatrice Lehman of New York and Theodore H. Lehman of Honolulu. The Rev. Gery G. Meehan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Old St. Joseph's Church in DePere, Wis., with Rabbi Michael V. Tillman taking part.
The bride, who graduated cum laude from Boston University, and the bridegroom, a graduate of Vassar College, received M.B.A. degrees from Harvard University, where they met.
Mrs. Lehman, 28 , is a pharmaceutical marketing manager in New York for Amgen, the biotechnology company. Her father is an internist in private practice in Green Bay.

Mr. Lehman, 36, is a merchant banking associate at Bear, Stearns & Company in New York. He is also the founder of Steamer Inc., a former maker of gourmet hot chocolate that was in New York. His mother, an architect, is an associate partner in Pei, Cobb, Freed & Partners, the New York architectural firm. His father, who is retired, was the chairman of T. H. Lehman & Company, an investment banking firm that was in New York.
